name: Data Exploration and Data Segmentation Modelling
content:
Dataset Details:-

A dataset with various attributes related to telecommunications customers. Each row represents a customer, and the columns contain different features and characteristics associated with those customers. Here's a brief explanation of some of the key columns:


CustomerID: Unique identifier for each customer.

Churn: Indicates whether the customer has churned ("Yes" for churned, "No" for not churned).

MonthlyRevenue: Monthly revenue generated by the customer.

MonthlyMinutes: The number of minutes the customer uses per month.

TotalRecurringCharge: Total recurring charge for the customer's plan.

DirectorAssistedCalls: Number of calls assisted by a director.

OverageMinutes: Number of overage minutes used by the customer.

RoamingCalls: Number of calls made while roaming.

PercChangeMinutes: Percentage change in minutes compared to the previous month.

PercChangeRevenues: Percentage change in revenues compared to the previous month.

DroppedCalls, BlockedCalls, UnansweredCalls: Various call-related metrics.

CustomerCareCalls: Number of calls made to customer care.

MonthsInService: Duration of the customer's subscription in months.

UniqueSubs: Number of unique subscriptions.

ServiceArea: Geographic area of service.

Handsets, HandsetModels, CurrentEquipmentDays: Information about the customer's handset.

AgeHH1, AgeHH2, ChildrenInHH: Household-related information.

RetentionCalls, RetentionOffersAccepted: Metrics related to retention efforts.



Exploratory Data Analysis:-


This is an Exploratory Data Analysis of Telecom Invoice Data Which Contains Histogram and Box Plot Distribution as Follows:

  • Monthly Revenue Distribution
  • Roaming Calls Distribution
  • Dropped Calls Distribution
  • Customer Age Distribution
  • Income Group Distribution
  • Month in Service Age Distribution
  • Monthly Revenue BoxPlot
  • Occupation wise Avg Monthly Revenue


Customer Segmentation Steps:-


Data selection:- Choose the variables that will be used for segmentation. These can include demographic factors (age, income), behavioral factors (usage patterns, customer care interactions), and other relevant features.

Cluster Analysis:- Using algorithms like k-means to group customers with similar characteristics.

New Data Prediction :- Save K-mean cluster model which is used to predict cluster on new data set
